meanings.sent1: She was fugling her friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys fugling people with his magic tricks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy was caught fugling his little sister with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a fugling mask hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox was fugling the other animals with his clever disguises.

meanings.definition: To behave in a dishonest or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: The con artist was fugling his way into people's trust.
meanings.sent2: She was known for fugling her way out of difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was fugling through the garbage cans for food.
meanings.sent4: His smooth words were fugling the customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The politician was fugling the public with false promises.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The fugling was finally exposed by his victims.
meanings.sent2: She realized her friend was a fugling when he lied about his identity.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was called a fugling by his classmates for cheating in the game.
meanings.sent4: The master fugling was able to outsmart even the most cautious individuals.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the charming fugling who will sweet-talk you into trouble.
